item.title: Control--Panel
item.description: And there is more on flickr

item.title: Infused design with Jared Spool - UX Podcast
item.description: We can identify business value by asking the following questions about the end results of our project: Will it increase revenue? Will it decrease expenses? Will it bring in new customers? Will it bring in more money from existing customers? Will it increase shareholder/taxpayer value? –> About business value

item.title: I don‚Äôt care what Airbnb is doing. (And neither should you.)
How and why asking for help
item.description: Asking for help is fine We tend to not ask for help. Usually because it transmit the idea of a weak person. It may expose our weakness right. But human being likes to help and saying you need some help is a good honest gesture. Because you can’t do everything alone right. 3 reinforcements that helps to get buys-in Being part of the group is something you have to consider when asking for help.

item.title: Start a localwiki.org page for Lausanne
item.description: Just created a page on LocalWiki about Lausanne. Being impressed by the story behind Davis LocalWiki and how it this city is using a wiki for online/open/free/ communication and API’s services. More about this on the about LocalWiki page.

item.title: Hiring web developers - some tips
item.description: Really like how the article makes clear the basics are more important than the hype.

item.title: HTTPS required is for the West White Web
About dat:// to a distributed Web
item.description: First I saw tweets about beaker browser so I installed it and then forget it. Then I saw this talk Imagine This: A Web Without Servers by Tara Vancil at JSConf EU 2018. And I remembered again. dat:// a protocol to allow a P2P web to exist. A concept of a fully distributed web where the architecture works without servers so to say or where every device may become a server.

item.title: How the Enlightenment Ends
item.description: The Enlightenment started with essentially philosophical insights spread by a new technology. Our period is moving in the opposite direction. It has generated a potentially dominating technology in search of a guiding philosophy.

item.title: Look for Integrity
item.description: ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre looking for three things, generally, in a person,‚Äù says Buffett. ‚ÄúIntelligence, energy, and integrity. And if they don‚Äôt have the last one, don‚Äôt even bother with the first two. I tell them, ‚ÄòEveryone here has the intelligence and energy‚Äîyou wouldn‚Äôt be here otherwise. But the integrity is up to you. You weren‚Äôt born with it, you can‚Äôt learn it in school.‚Äù

item.title: My leadership cheatsheet
item.description: Seeking the right role for an Entrepeneur becoming an observer instead of an active participant in your business Entrepreneurship is really just a fancy word for delegation “My company felt like an unmanned car, slowly swerving into the ditch only to be pulled back‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääusually by me‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääat the last second.” “Many CEO‚Äôs forget this and get stuck in sales, marketing, product‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääwhatever part of the business they love‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääwhile they ignore the bigger picture.

item.title: Design Systems
item.description: Marc Friederich from Lausanne based agency Antistatique will be discussing in ‘Design Systems’ how shifting from print to digital has shaped branding and design systems.

item.title: Marc Friederich üîÆ
item.description: About me Co-founder of Antistatique, a swiss web agency in Lausanne, Geneva and Miami. With over =(time() - 1998) years of web experience, Marc has carried out and managed all types of projects in the field. Since he has experience working all parts of the media production chain, he can take on many different roles when it comes to designing, developing, project management and quality control. He has a clear vision of what is required for each project, thanks to his expertise in human factors and ergonomics, usability, accessibility and technology.

item.title: Flexbox - layouting finally made easy
item.description: This talk will cover the flexible box module layout specifications, with samples and use cases. ‚Ä¢ Flex direction and understand axis ‚Ä¢ Justify-content, align-items and align-content when wrapping ‚Ä¢ Shrink, Grow, Basis ‚Ä¢ Order ‚Ä¢ Use case

item.title: Dynamic Style Guides ‚Äì Retour d'experience
item.description: Avec l‚Äô√©mergence des styles modulaires, le style guide est devenu un outil indispensable pour documenter et organiser le travail du frontend d√©veloppeur. V√©ritable moyen de communication entre designer et d√©veloppeur, le styleguide √©tablit un dialogue efficient et pratique. L‚Äôemploi d‚Äôun syst√®me de styleguide vous obligera √† penser et coder modulaire. En effet, si vous commencer par concevoir les √©l√©ments de votre design ind√©pendamment les uns des autres en ne les consultants que dans votre styleguide, vous aurez int√©gr√© le plus gros du concept.

item.title: Prototype in the browser
item.description: Rien ne vaut du papier et un bon vieux crayon pour coucher ses id√©es. Puis vient le moment o√π il faut pr√©senter et √©prouver son concept. Dans une d√©marche agile, il est indispensable d‚Äôobtenir rapidement un concept testable. √Ä travers plusieurs retours d‚Äôexp√©rience, cette pr√©sentation vous donnera un aper√ßu des m√©thodes de prototypage en HTML. Construire son interface en quelques lignes pour pouvoir la tester rapidement. Valable pour tous les types d‚Äôapplications, ces m√©thodes sont id√©ales pour r√©aliser des tests utilisateurs.

item.title: WordPress - feedback and lesson learned
item.description: Slides from our lessons learned and experience about wordpress project at Antistatique

item.title: Maintaining your working environment
item.description: It’s quite hard for a first post to choose a topic. I was used to blog a lot 6 years ago. My topics of choice were mainly webdesign, xhtml, css, my student life and so on. I stopped for many reasons (personal life, moving a year to finland, building my company) but since I like sharing things and collecting thoughs about by day and night work. I am here to share.
